alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 24 at 8:06PM MDT until May 24 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL YELLOWSTONE COUNTY... At 806 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Heaviest rain occurred at and north of the Rims, and between Laurel and Billings along and south of I-90. Flash flooding is likely ongoing in those areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Billings and Laurel. While no more rain is expected, flash flooding impacts may linger over the next 1 to 2 hours. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
